div.h3: COVID-19 Update-East Penn School District Closed for the Remainder of the 2019/2020 School Year

div.p: As announced this morning by Governor Tom Wolf, the East Penn School District will be closed for the remainder of the 2019/2020 School Year. This decision was made to protect the health and safety of our students and community during the COVID-19 pandemic. While we have been preparing for this possible outcome for several weeks, news like this is never easy to hear. more details

p.strong: **Information on this page could change often. Please check back regularly for updates.**

div.p:
As announced on April 9th by Governor Tom Wolf, the East Penn School District will be closed for the remainder of the 2019/2020 School Year. This decision was made to protect the health and safety of our students and community during the COVID-19 pandemic. While we have been preparing for this possible outcome for several weeks, news like this is never easy to hear.
In the best interest of our students, we move forward with our Continuity of Learning plan for the remainder of the school year. More details will follow as we work on the long-term planning and prioritization of events and activities impacted by the closure.

ul.li: Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, especially after using the bathroom, before eating, and after blowing your nose, coughing, or sneezing. If soap and water are not available, use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer.
Avoid touching your eyes, nose, and mouth with unwashed hands.
Avoid close contact with people who are sick.
Stay home when you are sick.
Cover your cough or sneeze with a tissue, then throw the tissue in the trash.
Clean and disinfect frequently touched objects and surfaces.

Lookout for friends and loved ones who would be considered more vulnerable and offer support. Individuals with chronic health issues and/or individuals experiencing severe symptoms should be evaluated by a medical professional.
